articles.title: What Is a Crypto-Backed Loan and How It Works: A Simple Explanation
articles.author: Sarah Dunsby
articles.summary: Borrowing against crypto refers to using digital assets as collateral to obtain a loan in stablecoins or another supported currency. The collateral is typically locked by the provider until the debt is repaid. LTV (Loan-to-Value ratio) is a metric that shows the relation between the loan amount and the current value of the collateral. Most platforms that offer crypto-backed loans set upper LTV limits. When the ratio reaches this level, the platform liquidates the collateral to avoid losses.

articles.summary: The newly elected president of Bolivia, Rodrigo Paz, has announced plans to deploy blockchain technology in his government. He was elected on November 8th. He is the first Bolivian president to be elected on a non-conformist ticket since independence.

articles.title: Bitcoin Mining Stocks Surge Today as Market Optimism Builds
articles.author: Bitcoin Magazine
articles.summary: Shares of leading Bitcoin mining firms surged today. Marathon Digital Holdings (NASDAQ: MARA) climbed 7.97% to $21.13, Riot Platforms (NASADA: RIOT) jumped 11.21%  to $22.28, and CleanSpark (NASDA: CLSK) rose 9.09%

articles.title: Binance Founder CZ Predicts Bitcoin Will Flip Gold's $30 Trillion Market
articles.author: Coin Gape
articles.summary: Binance founder Changpeng Zhao has reignited the long-running debate between Bitcoin (BTC) and gold. He predicts Bitcoin will become more valuable than gold in the future. CZ is also known as "Changpeng CZ" and "CZ".

articles.title: After 11 persons are caught in 5 days, ICA reminds travellers to declare when bringing cash exceeding S$20,000
articles.author: Anna Maria Romero
articles.summary: Travellers were recently caught moving large amounts of money into and out of Singapore without proper declaration. Travellers must submit an electronic declaration within 72 hours before entering or leaving Singapore via MyICA mobile app or ICA's website. 11 travellers who were moving more than S$20,000 in cash, or its equivalent in foreign currencies, in or out of the city-state had been apprehended.

articles.title: As Louvre reels, a look at iconic museum heists
articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.summary: Thieves stole works by Rembrandt, Vermeer, Degas and Manet from Berlin's Bode Museum in 2017. Two years later, another night-time raid targeted Dresden's Green Vault and stole diamond-studded royal jewels from the 18th century. In 2019, Blenheim Palace was the site of a theft of a fully functioning 18-carat gold toilet.
